cause.description:
GridRepublic makes it easy for people to participate in and meaningfully support scientific and medical research. The vehicle is a novel form of philanthropy called "Volunteer Computing": from our website, PC users download a bit of software which enables them to lend their computers to Cancer, AIDS, and Malaria study, climate modeling, and other issues -- all while the devices are not otherwise in use. By aggregating idle resources from participants around the world, research projects get access to massive "virtual" supercomputers -- thus making possible investigations that would otherwise be impossible. (Developed in collaboration with the BOINC project at the University of California at Berkeley)
1. We provide a non-financial means for people to support important scientific and medical research
2. User-contributed computing resources are making possible research that would otherwise be impossible
3. It's easy, safe and reliable; and it makes a difference.
cause.mission: Supports scientific and medical research by use of Volunteer Computing.
